page.title: 05WELSH LANGUAGE IN AMMANFORD
page.content: The total population of the Ammanford area (including Tycroes and Saron) in 1981 was approx. 10,500. Ammanford having 5,562 and Tycroes and Saron 4,500. The total number of Welsh speakers in urban Ammanford was 3,940 or 70.8%. Tycroes and Saron were proportionally similar. Children under the age of 3 were not counted. The approximate ages of Welsh speakers in this area were mostly over 50 years of age. The education in Primary Schools has been greatly improved - nearly all having Welsh speaking lessons in many subjects. We have one primary school which is all Welsh - most of the children that leave here go to the welsh band in the Amman Valley Comprehensive School. Here in the first band class we have History, Geography and Religious Education in Welsh.
